_header: When the nose blacks and the lip quakes
_description: Signs of death — nine lines, the first seven roughly rhyming with ‘-es’ endings

TCD312.First Lines: Wen þe nese blakesand þe lippe quakes…
TCD312.Last Lines:
…he þat bi for was proudHe sal haue bout a
                    Clout
TCD312.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Signs of Death in Middle English.” 
             Mediaeval Studies
         32 (1970): 282-98: 295.
